intro: Duroia laevis, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
